title: Canadian Warrior turned Pastor, Jordan Peterson, Boyos and the Meaning Crisis
description:
Neil Whitman was introduced to be by Stef-the-Boyo of the Uberboyos who I spoke with a few weeks ago. He's a Reformed Baptist Pastor in New Brunswick Canada. He served in the Canadian armed forces in Haiti and Afghanistan in the Infantry recently retiring into the ministry in a Sovereign Grace congregation near the base. He's been following the rise of Jordan Peterson and now the conversations in the meaning crisis. He's seen plenty of crisis first hand and it has shaped his life and calling. Here's our conversation. 

His YouTube Channel https://youtu.be/fMQRgS9H2nI
My talk with the Boyos https://youtu.be/F1jZJtwb9TU

Uberboyos, working with a young man
Petersonians
Every officer he’s met under 30 for the last 5 years
Afghanistan, Canada participated in that conflict in a very direct way
Kandahar
Warriors, classical manly characteristic, praised and celebrated among men and women
Had a strong morale
2012 turning point, went onto a training mission
New government put out a new white paper, defense policy, and stripped everything away
Kinder, gentler politically correct army, 
Change sexual behavior to a modern, inclusive attitude
Perception of persecution
Progressive post-evangelicalism
Run from the church as a competent counselor
Evangelical church has failed at giving a prophylactic to reality
Hasn’t tried earnestly to address the problem of evil
The god that they have been taught about is not the God of the Bible
Lacks a remedy when people have been hurt

Psychological treatment does nothing for moral injuries
David Grossman, On Killing, On Combat

The meaning crisis
A different dialogue, meaning crisis is a complicated thing
Gordian knot, it needs a sword
